import React, { useState } from 'react' const CountryDetails = ({country,filter,counts}) =>{ const [count, setCounts] = useState(''); let result = country.filter(item => item.name.toLowerCase().includes(filter)) console.log(counts.value) return(
{result.length < 10 ?
{result.length > 1 ? result.map((filterCountry,idx) => (

{filterCountry.name}

{idx === parseInt(count) ?

{filterCountry.name}

capital {filterCountry.capital}

population {filterCountry.population}

languages

    {filterCountry.languages.map((language,index)=>(
  • {language.name}
    • ))}
:
}
)) : result.map((filterCountry,idx) => (

{filterCountry.name}

capital {filterCountry.capital}

population {filterCountry.population}

languages

    {filterCountry.languages.map((language,index)=>(
  • {language.name}
    • ))}
)) }
:

Too many matches, specify another filter

}
) } export default CountryDetails
